items.title: What we know so far about the Bondi Beach shooting
items.summary: Sixteen people are dead after two gunmen fired dozens of shots into crowds of people at Bondi Beach. Here's what we know so far.

items.title: Bondi Beach shooting updates: Terrorist attack on Jewish community event — as it happened
items.summary: Twelve people are confirmed dead and dozens are injured in a terrorist attack on the Chanukah by the Sea celebration at Sydney's Bondi Beach. Look back at our coverage from the day.

items.title: Matt Wright's character references from famous singer, high-powered business person, media heavyweight released
items.summary: Country music star Lee Kernaghan, powerful business person Mick Burns, traditional owner Brian Tipungwuti and media heavyweight Nick Fordham all provided character references for celebrity crocodile wrangler Matt Wright ahead of his sentencing, court documents show.

items.title: Short-form videos could be harming young minds
items.summary: Online short-form video has shifted from a light distraction to a constant backdrop in many children's lives. But they were never built with children in mind, although many children use them daily.

items.title: Brendon McCullum vows against 'knee-jerk reactions' for third Ashes Test in Adelaide
items.summary: England coach Brendon McCullum confirms his side's batting line-up will be unchanged for its must-win third Ashes Test in Adelaide.

items.title: Researchers call for water safety to be part of English education for migrants
items.summary: As the country heads into the summer holidays, experts are again warning Australians to be aware of swim safety at beaches, pools and other waterways.

items.title: Australians open to dealing with AI on a Triple Zero emergency call, study finds
items.summary: Could artificial intelligence speed up emergency responses by receiving a caller's video or smartwatch data and capturing words like "knife" and "collision"? Most people think so and welcome the technology's potential, a survey finds.

items.title: 'It's cooked': Big Brother contestant quit so she could afford the dentist
items.summary: Data obtained by the ABC shows people are waiting months, if not years, for dental care in every Australian state and territory due to the cost.

items.title: Police condemn 'outrageous' Guildford West shooting as vision shows 30 bullets fired into home
items.summary: The vision shows the moment a gunman sprayed an underworld associate's home with up to 30 rounds while two women and a child were inside.

items.title: I’m heading overseas. Do I really need travel vaccines?
items.summary: Australia is in its busiest month for short-term overseas travel. And there are so many things to consider when planning your trip. Unfortunately, it's easy to overlook the importance of pre-travel vaccinations.

items.title: Coles and Woolworths hit back at government's price gouging ban
items.summary: Lower grocery bills are being promised within this new ban on price gouging, but giant retailers say they are the ones feeling the pinch.

items.title: Virtual fencing is now legal in NSW. This is what you need to know
items.summary: NSW farmers have been given the green light to use virtual fencing, providing an option over traditional posts and wires. Here is how it works.

items.title: Books reflecting remote Indigenous lifestyles and culture 'key' to students' reading success
items.summary: An educator says books that reflect remote Indigenous cultures and lifestyles are "the key to success" in improving reading outcomes for First Nations students.

items.title: Brett Lee backs current Australian bowling attack as greatest ever
items.summary: Brett Lee ranks Australia's bowling attack as better than the one he was part of, which featured the likes of Glenn McGrath and Shane Warne.

items.title: Orchid enthusiasts call for greater protection for native species facing habitat threats
items.summary: Two centuries after orchids were first documented in South Australia, photographers are still discovering new plants.

items.summary: With sounds recorded in a makeshift studio, this group of high school students produced music about First Nations culture.

items.title: Two students killed, nine injured in shooting at Brown University — as it happened
items.summary: Two students have been killed and nine other people have been injured after a gunman entered an engineering building during final exams at Brown University in the US.

items.title: Conservationist uses invasive fox fur to make ethical clothing
items.summary: In six months, Emma Sinclair went from not knowing how to sew to launching her own fashion label based around fox fur.

items.title: Brown University shooting in US leaves two students dead and nine injured
items.summary: Police detain a "person of interest" in connection with the Brown University shooting that left two students dead and another nine people wounded.

items.title: Pulp Fiction, The Mask actor Peter Greene dies aged 60
items.summary: Peter Greene, a character actor best known for his role as the iconic villain, Zed in Pulp Fiction, has died.

items.title: Two-thirds of women escaping violence in Broome cannot access help
items.summary: In a region with Western Australia's highest rates of family and domestic violence, a Kimberley service provider says it can only help one-third of women who need it.

items.title: UK police won't probe claim former prince Andrew asked bodyguard to investigate Virginia Roberts Giuffre
items.summary: London's police force says it will not take further action over claims that former prince Andrew asked his protection officer to carry out checks on Virginia Roberts Giuffre.

items.title: Three quarters of Canberra's suburbs see reduction in tree canopy despite government's 2045 goal
items.summary: It's called the 'bush capital', but three quarters of Canberra's suburbs have recorded a decline in tree coverage.

items.title: Alpha Bakery making famous pies again with family support after dementia diagnosis
items.summary: Christopher Tilse has worked from dawn to dusk in a bakery most of his life. Dementia made that a challenge, but thanks to family support, he is still baking.

items.title: Medical groups push for consequences for freebirth 'birthkeepers' posing as medical professionals
items.summary: A number of recent deaths linked to freebirths — where a pregnant woman chooses to give birth with no registered medical professional present — is prompting health groups to speak out about rising levels of misinformation.

items.title: Lionel Messi's India tour begins in chaos, seats ripped out in Kolkata
items.summary: Indian football fans ripped up seats and invaded the pitch in Kolkata as Lionel Messi's first appearance in India took a chaotic and dangerous turn.

items.title: Sydney Sweeney transformed herself to play Christy Martin in a biopic as Hollywood struggles
items.summary: Sydney Sweeney changed a lot about herself to play Christy Martin in a biopic about the boxer. She says it was a role she had to take.

items.title: The Kaurna cultural program inspiring students in Adelaide's south
items.summary: Kanyanyapilla means "place of many eagles", and it's where Indigenous students in Adelaide are coming to connect with Kaurna culture.

items.title: Earthquake due 'in foreseeable future' after 70 years of Adelaide tremors
items.summary: Adelaide sits on the most active seismic zone in Australia and has more than its fair share of tremors below magnitude-4, but it's been 71 years since it was rocked by a serious earthquake. Now, it's a matter of when, not if, it gets another one.

items.title: Gippsland teenager Ethan Monck celebrates first job after a lifetime battling cancer
items.summary: Ethan Monck's health problems began the day he was born. Now aged 17, he's celebrating after starting his first job and the freedom it gives him to pursue his hobbies.

items.title: Iron deficiency is a challenge for many female athletes, like Super Netball's Zara Walters
items.summary: Zara Walters felt tired, dizzy and unable to recover from training sessions — then she found out she was low in iron. It's a condition that often goes undiagnosed, especially in female athletes.

items.title: After tragedies and rescues, Tasmanian bushwalkers urged to 'be prepared' for all conditions this summer
items.summary: It has been a busy year for search and rescue operations in the Tasmanian high country. Authorities say a concerning number of visitors to the state's famous national parks are ill-prepared for the fickle weather — even during summer.

items.title: Two US troops killed in Syria ambush along with one American civilian
items.summary: Two US service members and one American civilian are killed in an ambush in central Syria.

items.title: How Benjamin Netanyahu's corruption trial became a struggle for Israel itself
items.summary: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu's backers view his corruption trial as a witch hunt — but his detractors argue it is the system finally catching up to a ruthless political operative who is prepared to do anything to hold on to power.

items.title: Sanction-skirting 'shadow fleets' in Trump's sights. Here's how they work
items.summary: Tensions between the US and Venezuela are soaring after American forces seized an oil tanker in the Caribbean Sea. So why is US President Donald Trump targeting so-called "shadow fleets"?

items.title: 'I was tricked': African athlete lured to Russia for work, ends up on front lines of Ukraine war
items.summary: Vladimir Putin says Russia has "no need" to recruit foreign fighters to bolster its invasion of Ukraine, but inside this prisoner of war camp, people have a very different story.

items.title: Hard Quiz: It's the season of giving so I'm gifting you a chance at redemption
items.summary: Your track record doesn't leave me hopeful.

items.title: Lizelle Lee stars as Hobart Hurricanes claim maiden WBBL title
items.summary: Hurricanes opener Lizelle Lee hits an unbeaten 77 as her side claims its first WBBL title with a dominant eight-wicket win over the Scorchers.

items.title: Usman Khawaja open to middle order role for third Ashes Test in Adelaide
items.summary: Australia batter Usman Khawaja is feeling 100 per cent fit and is open to a return to the middle order for the third Ashes Test in Adelaide.

items.title: China Coast Guard fires water cannon at Philippine fishing vessels in South China Sea, Manila says
items.summary: Manila's coastguard says nearly two dozen Philippine fishing boats near Sabina Shoal were targeted with water cannon and blocking manoeuvres on Friday.

items.title: Roger Rasheed slams 'battle of the sexes' tennis clash between Nick Kyrgios and Aryna Sabalenka
items.summary: High-profile Australian tennis coach Roger Rasheed has questioned the value of the upcoming "battle of the sexes"-style exhibition match between Nick Kyrgios and Aryna Sabalenka.

items.title: Jailed Myanmar leader Aung San Suu Kyi's supporters rally in Sydney to protest junta elections
items.summary: Aung San Suu Kyi's son leads a rally of supporters in Sydney as part of global demonstrations trying to increase international pressure on Myanmar's ruling military junta.

items.title: Severe heatwave cancels event, closes popular abalone fishing spot as season begins
items.summary: Perth is in the grip of its hottest spell so far this summer, forcing the closure of a popular tourist attraction as abalone fishing season got underway.

items.title: United Nations delegation warns of Australia's treatment of prisoners, detainees and breach in human rights
items.summary: A delegation of United Nations inspectors have raised the alarm about Australia's detention facilities and a breach of human rights.

items.title: Desert Fireball Network students find fist-sized meteorite in outback WA
items.summary: PhD students from Curtin University have found a 300-gram meteorite after a five-day search in remote bushland.

items.title: What you should know about 'Bali belly' and how to avoid it before it ruins your holiday
items.summary: Every year about 1.5 million Australians travel to Bali. Chances are either you or someone you know has caught a stomach bug after travelling to the popular Indonesian destination. So what can you do to avoid it?

items.title: Australian fans among most active in searching for FIFA World Cup tickets
items.summary: Australia are among the countries with the most ticket requests for next year's World Cup, which is bound to please Socceroos coach Tony Popovic and his team.

items.title: Government-formed agency recommends against NSW coal industry expansion
items.summary: Coal mining extensions and expansions will continue, the New South Wales premier says, despite a government-appointed agency finding further approvals were not consistent with emissions targets.

items.title: Google to build undersea cables in Papua New Guinea under Australia defence treaty
items.summary: PNG says the measure will provide a key upgrade to its digital backbone and link the north and south of the nation with high-capacity cables.

items.title: Perth's queer nightclub, Connections, celebrates 50 years of dancing and difference
items.summary: Founded in 1975, when homosexuality was still illegal in Western Australia, Connections nightclub has seen waves of social change and kept the party going.

items.title: Federal police release nine images to help identify online child sex abuse victims
items.summary: These photographs might look like everyday objects, but the AFP-led Australian Centre to Counter Child Exploitation (ACCCE) believe they could help identify victims of online child sexual exploitation.

items.summary: Crocodile wrangler Matt Wright built a television and tourism empire in the Northern Territory, but that's all come crashing down.

items.title: 18-year-old man in critical condition after Gold Coast assault
items.summary: An 18-year-old man is in hospital in a critical condition after being assaulted on the Gold Coast on Friday night.

items.title: Melbourne lawyer Dean Hadjina sentenced to prison for stealing from grieving widow
items.summary: Dean Hadjina is sentenced to prison for stealing $482,154 from a vulnerable widow who spoke little English as she sought compensation payouts after her husband's workplace death.

items.title: Underwater microphone records humpback whale sounds off NSW south coast
items.summary: Underwater microphones off the NSW south coast capture consistent humpback whale sounds throughout the 2024 migration season.

items.title: Migrant workers raise concerns at modern slavery inquiry in Coffs Harbour
items.summary: Witnesses have told an inquiry into modern slavery that migrant workers are being exploited in the nation's blueberry capital.

items.title: Record gold prices drive investment in exploration across Australia
items.summary: The money being spent on drilling for gold has increased 45 per cent in the past 12 months.

items.title: Grassroots First Nations organisation flags concern for at-risk youth under social media ban
items.summary: Social media can help at-risk youth connect with support services, so what impact will the federal government's under-16s ban have on those community hubs?
